notes: Teacher, known for portraits of children and youth
Greek descent, founder of Society of South Russian Artists
Member USSR Academy of Arts 1947, founder industrial landscape
Honored Artist of Ukrainian SSR 1946, created postcards and posters
Painter from Kherson, researched by Volodymyr Chupryna
Polish nobility family, founder of Society of South Russian Artists 1889

birth_place: Petrovka, Genichesky district, Kherson region, Ukraine
notes: Graduated Chisinau Republican Art College 1969, lives in Kherson since 1971
Student of Kiev Art Institute 1939-1940, member Union of Artists of Ukraine 1982

Graduated Krasnodar Art College 1933, Kiev Art Institute 1945 (workshop of A. Shovkunenko). Member Union of Artists Ukrainian SSR. WWII veteran, Order of Glory 3rd degree. Taught at Kiev Art Institute since 1952, professor since 1971. Honored Artist of USSR 1969. Specialized in Hutsul life themes, still life, landscape, portrait, genre paintings
Worked at Gerasimov Institute of Cinematography. Known for film production design work

Graduated Kyiv Art School 1913 as Artist First Degree. Teacher Kyiv Art School 1915-1925, professor Kyiv Art Institute until 1932, then Kharkiv Art Institute until 1941. Remained in Kharkiv during German occupation to preserve Institute. Persona non grata until rehabilitation 1973. Retrospective 1979

Studied Cracow Academy of Arts and Ukrainian Studio of Plastic Arts Prague. Settled Paris 1928. Associated with Durand-Ruel Gallery from 1943. Works in museums Paris, London, Stockholm, Lviv, Lucerne, Oxford University collection

Studied with K.F. Bogaevsky and N. Barsamov. Member Union of Artists USSR 1953. Honored Artist Ukraine 1972, People's Artist Ukraine 1985. Gold medal "For Contribution to World Culture" 2010. Lives Yalta. Called "Soviet post-impressionist". Works in major Ukrainian museums

Graduate Berlin Academy of Art 1924. Worked Paris 1925-1936, recruited by GPU as Soviet agent 1933. Returned USSR 1936, moved Kyiv 1944. Winner Shevchenko National Prize 1972. People's Artist USSR 1985. Exhibited Berlin, Paris, Milan, Stockholm, Rome, London, Toronto. Most famous work: "Sinister Sea"

birth_place: Chornyi Ostriv, Galicia (now Lviv Oblast), Ukraine
notes: Graduate Lviv Institute of Applied and Decorative Art 1953 (studied under Roman Selsky, Yosyp Bokshai). Member Union of Artists USSR 1958. Honored Artist Ukraine 1996, People's Artist Ukraine 2006, Shevchenko National Prize 1999. Known for expressionist landscapes with brilliant colors. Prominent Lviv school painter

Note: Russian artist, not Ukrainian. Member of The Wanderers 1889, Union of Russian Artists 1903. Taught at Moscow School of Painting, Sculpture and Architecture and Vkhutemas 1922-1924. People's Artist of USSR 1927. Known for peasant life themes, especially Russian women

Graduate physics/mathematics University of Kharkiv 1893. Studied Académie Julian Paris 1893-1896 under Jules Lefebvre and Tony Robert-Fleury. Student of Arkhyp Kuindzhi at Imperial Academy Saint Petersburg 1896. Specialized in landscapes with figures. Works in Kherson Regional Art Museum looted by Russia 2022
